page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: PYPE HAYES IS MENTIONED IN THE DOMESDAY BOOK WHEN IT WAS A MANOR RUN BY WILLIAM FITZANSCULF.THE MANOR HOUSE WAS JUST OUTSIDE OUR BLOCK,(THE LAST ONE WAS KNOCKED DOWN IN 1931). IN THE 14th CENTURY A LOT OF THE PEOPLE WHO LIVED IN THE AREA WERE KILLED BY THE PLAGUE INCLUDING THE WIFE AND ALL THE CHILDREN OF THE MAUNSELL FAMILY WHO THEN OWNED THE MANOR.LATER,THOMAS DE BEAUCHAMP,EARL OF WARWICK,BOUGHT THE MANOR OF 900 ACRES FOR 133 POUNDS 6S. THE MANOR WAS SOLD TO VARIOUS OTHER PEOPLE INCLUDING THE ARDENS RELATED TO WILLIAM SHAKESPEARE AND TO THE HOLTE FAMILY WHO BUILT ASTON HALL. IN THE 1930'S A BIG HOUSING ESTATE WAS BUILT AND A NEW MAIN ROAD.LATER,IN THE 1960'S ANOTHER ESTATE WAS BUILT AT CASTLE VALE ON LAND THAT WAS USED BY THE AIR FORCE IN WORLD WAR TWO.
